definition: since (some point in the past)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
to drop/to fall/to come down/to descend
to surrender/to capitulate/to subdue/to tame

sentences.english: Starting with Socrates, philosophers have been searching for the eternal verities.
sentences.chinese: 自蘇格拉底以降，哲學家一直在追尋永恆的真理。

sentences.english: Modernization has been the topic in the course of a century's Chinese history since the end of Oing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: “現代化”是清末以降百年中國歷史進程的主題。

sentences.english: These resulted from the gradual intensification of imperial power starting from the middle period of Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 諸如此者，皆與皇權自劉宋中葉以降漸趨強化有關。

sentences.english: After Tang and Song Dynasty, the style of landscape-painting represented by the two Lis weakened gradually.
sentences.chinese: 唐宋以降，以“二李”爲代表的青綠山水逐漸式微。

sentences.english: The emperors of past dynasties have imitated the example since the appearance of it in the Western Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 據文獻記載，鐵券出現於西漢，魏晉以降多有頒賜。

sentences.english: With the introduction of the concept of immortals from the Han dynasty on, the mountain god gradually became defined as Lord Lu.
sentences.chinese: 隨着漢代以降神仙說的傳入，山神逐漸確定爲廬君。

sentences.english: From the mid-Ching onwards, large numbers of emigrants went abroad from Fujian and Guangdong.
sentences.chinese: 清中葉以降，大量的閩粵移民出洋。

sentences.english: In addition, annexing warfare pricked up the occurence of flood since the Spring and Autumn period.
sentences.chinese: 春秋以降兼併戰爭加劇了水災的發生。

sentences.english: Since the later period of Ching Dynasty, western missionary appeared in China as the stars in multitude.
sentences.chinese: 清季以降，西方傳教士現身於中國者，可謂不絕於途。

sentences.english: During Chunqiu period, Fatality Order declined and Zhou Rite was faced with legitimacy crises.
sentences.chinese: 春秋以降，天命隕落，周禮出現嚴重的合法性危機。

definition: to begin/to start/then/only then
to decline/to wane/weakened/enfeebled/in decline
the starting point
scholar
vestigial residue/a throwback (to a former age)
to propose/to put forward (an idea)/to initiate
to esteem/to revere/to think highly of sb
Confucian
first day of the first lunar month/(old) calendar promulgated by the first emperor of a dynasty
the whole world/throughout the land/everything under the sun
dividing line between distinct realms/boundary/field-allocation (in Chinese astrology, the association between celestial regions and corresponding terrestrial realms)
to change/to modify
to believe in (a deity or other supernatural being)/to worship
to bear in mind
tragic disaster/disturbance and bloodshed
the multitude of common people (in highbrow literature)/plebeian
